apis.description: Send text message and return broadcastId

operations.summary: Send text message and return broadcastId
operations.notes:
Sending a text message requires at least a toNumber and a message. SendText starts a text campaign and returns the broadcastId if campaign is successful started. This returned broadcastId can be passed to QueryTexts to get state of text messages in campaign and get list of individual textId for use in GetText calls. The broadcastId can also be passed to GetBroadcastStats to get information about the text campaign, such as BilledAmount, Duration, State, etc...

The industry standard is for text messages to be limited to 160 characters or less. If the message is over 160 characters then a BigMessageStrategy should be selected in the TextBroadcastConfig.

parameters.name: RequestId
parameters.description: Unique ID, used to de-dup requests and make sure request is not processed twice

parameters.name: To
parameters.description: List of E.164 11 digit numbers space or comma separated

parameters.name: From
parameters.description: E.164 11 digit number or short code

parameters.name: LocalRestrictBegin
parameters.description: Earliest time a client can be contacted in the timezone associated with the number's NPA/NXX

parameters.name: LocalRestrictEnd
parameters.description: Latest time a client can be contacted in the timezone associated with the number's NPA/NXX

parameters.name: RetryPhoneTypes
parameters.description: Phone types to call in retry

parameters.name: Message
parameters.description: 160 char or less message to be sent in text broadcast. Use rented 'keyword' in message if need response

parameters.name: BigMessageStrategy
parameters.description: Set strategy if message is over 160 chars (default: SEND_MULTIPLE)

parameters.name: UseDefaultBroadcast
parameters.description: If true send text through existing default broadcast (default: false)

apis.description: List sent and received text messages

operations.summary: List sent and received text messages
operations.notes: Query for text messages using standard ActionQuery which filters on batchId, broadcastId, toNumber, etc... Returns a list of text messages and all associated info. See GetText to return just a single text action by id.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: Max number of results to return limited to 1000 (default: 1000)

parameters.name: State
parameters.description: List of Action States to query on

parameters.name: Result
parameters.description: List of Results to query on

parameters.name: IntervalBegin
parameters.description: Beginning of DateTime interval to search on

parameters.name: IntervalEnd
parameters.description: End of DateTime interval to search on

parameters.name: LabelName
parameters.description: Label that result must have to be included

apis.description: Gets a text message by ID

operations.summary: Gets a text message by ID
operations.notes:
Return individual text message. See QueryTexts to return a list of text messages and determine individual textIds.

General usage is to start a text campaign using SendText, then to pass returned broadcastId to QueryTexts to determine textIds of text messages created. This GetText can then be called with unique textId to determine info and state of text message.

Create and configure new autoreply message for existing Did

Auto-Replys are text message replys sent to a customer when a customer replys to a text message from a campaign. A keyword will need to have been purchased before an Auto-Reply can be created.

parameters.name: Number
parameters.description: Phone number to configure an auto reply message

operations.notes: Query for autoreplies using optional number

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: Max number of results to return limited to 1000 (default: 1000)

operations.notes: Returns autoreply by id or error if doesn't exist
Delete autoreply by id if exists. Returns error if doesn't exist
